newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Bids slip on MGE decline.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Bids slip on MGE decline.

text.p: Cash bids for dark northern spring wheat slipped on Thursday, in tandem with a dip in MGE futures, and movement was slow ahead of the three-day July 4 holiday weekend, several cash merchants said.

More rains fell across the Red River Valley in North Dakota, exacerbating worries about crop damage. Heavy rains pelted the region late Tuesday and Wednesday, submerging some fields under more than six inches of water, dealers said.
"This rain today is more of a constant drizzle," a North Dakota dealer said. "Just enough to keep the farmers out of the fields and keep things too wet for comfort."
Further west, rains tapered off during the day and light showers were forecast for the evening, followed by clearer weather on Friday, one merchandiser said.
Farmers continued to hold on to old crop supplies in hopes of higher prices, and new crop sales were scant.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring,
durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
